## Advance Contract Award Notice (ACAN) for Local Access Service, Prince Rupert Territory, British Columbia

**Reference Number:** PW-22-01017085

**Solicitation Number:** R000130657

**Publication Date:** 2022-12-13

**Tender Closing Date:** 2022-12-27T14:00:00

## Background Information
Shared Services Canada (SSC) is issuing a Advance Contract Award Notice (ACAN) for the provision of Local Access Service (LAS) to its offices located across Prince Rupert Territory, British Columbia.

## Description of the Requirement
SSC has a requirement for the provision of LAS to support its operations in the government facilities. The successful supplier must demonstrate a minimum of 10 years of experience in delivering complex, feature-rich LAS to large-scale customers. In addition, the supplier must have at least 5 years of experience in delivering LAS within the last 10 years for the given geographic areas.

## Supplier Requirements
To be eligible to submit a statement of capabilities, suppliers must meet the following requirements:

* Minimum of 10 years of experience in delivering complex, feature-rich LAS to large-scale customers
* At least 5 years of experience in delivering LAS within the last 10 years for the given geographic areas
* Minimum of 5 years of experience in supporting at least 50% of the volume of total approximate local access lines across the applicable geographic region.

## Security Requirement
The procurement process involves a requirement for vendor and personnel security screening.

## Closing Date and Time for Accepting Statements of Capabilities
The closing date and time for accepting statements of capabilities is December 27, 2022 at 14:00:00. Interested suppliers are required to submit a statement of capabilities to SSC’s procurement team leader, Jean-Charles St-Onge, via email at Jean-Charles.St-Onge@ssc-spc.gc.ca.

## More Information
For more information, please contact SSC’s procurement team leader, Jean-Charles St-Onge, directly. Note: SSC will either proceed with a full tendering process or award the contract to the pre-selected supplier based on the statements of capabilities received. If no other supplier submits a statement of capabilities that meets the requirements, SSC will award the contract to the pre-selected supplier.
